gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 16,29]]The disciples said to Jesus, "Now you are talking plainly, and not in any figure of speech.
[[Jn 16,30]]Now we realize that you know everything and that you do not need to have anyone question you. Because of this we believe that you came from God."
[[Jn 16,31]]Jesus answered them, "Do you believe now?
[[Jn 16,32]]Behold, the hour is coming and has arrived when each of you will be scattered to his own home and you will leave me alone. But I am not alone, because the Father is with me.
[[Jn 16,33]]I have told you this so that you might have peace in me. In the world you will have trouble, but take courage, I have conquered the world."

first_reading.title: Acts of the Apostles
first_reading.text:
[[Ac 19,1]]While Apollos was in Corinth, Paul traveled through the interior of the country and came down to Ephesus where he found some disciples.
[[Ac 19,2]]He said to them, "Did you receive the holy Spirit when you became believers?" They answered him, "We have never even heard that there is a holy Spirit."
[[Ac 19,3]]He said, "How were you baptized?" They replied, "With the baptism of John."
[[Ac 19,4]]Paul then said, "John baptized with a baptism of repentance, telling the people to believe in the one who was to come after him, that is, in Jesus."
[[Ac 19,5]]When they heard this, they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus.
[[Ac 19,6]]And when Paul laid (his) hands on them, the holy Spirit came upon them, and they spoke in tongues and prophesied.
[[Ac 19,7]]Altogether there were about twelve men.
[[Ac 19,8]]He entered the synagogue, and for three months debated boldly with persuasive arguments about the kingdom of God.
